class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">CI/CD</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Pipeline</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">on:</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">push:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">branches:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">main</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">pull_request:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">branches:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">main</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">jobs:</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">build:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">runs-on:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">ubuntu-latest</span></span><span>
    
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">steps:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Checkout du repository</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Checkout</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">code</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">uses:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">actions/checkout@v2</span></span><span>

      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Setup de Node.js</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Setup</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Node.js</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">uses:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">actions/setup-node@v2</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">with:</span></span><span>
          </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">node-version:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'16'</span></span><span>  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Remplacez par la version de Node.js que vous utilisez</span></span><span>

      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Installation des dépendances</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Install</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">dependencies</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
          npm install
</span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Lancement des tests</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Run</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">tests</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
          npm test
</span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Build Docker image</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Build</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">image</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
          docker build -t yourusername/yourimage:latest .
</span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Push de l'image vers Docker Hub</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Push</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">image</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">to</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Hub</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
          echo ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }} | docker login --username ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }} --password-stdin
          docker push yourusername/yourimage:latest
</span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># (Optionnel) Déploiement sur un serveur via SSH</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Deploy</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">to</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">server</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">via</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">SSH</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">if:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">success()</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
          ssh -i ${{ secrets.SSH_PRIVATE_KEY }} user@your-server-ip 'cd /path/to/your/app &amp;&amp; docker-compose pull &amp;&amp; docker-compose up -d'
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<h3 data-start="1693" data-end="1734" class="">3. Configuration des Secrets GitHub :</h3>
<p data-start="1735" data-end="1840" class="">Vous devrez configurer des secrets pour Docker Hub et SSH dans les paramètres de votre repository GitHub.</p>
<ul data-start="1842" data-end="2061">
<li data-start="1842" data-end="1901" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1844" data-end="1901" class=""><strong data-start="1844" data-end="1863">DOCKER_USERNAME</strong> : Votre nom d'utilisateur Docker Hub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1902" data-end="1978" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1904" data-end="1978" class=""><strong data-start="1904" data-end="1923">DOCKER_PASSWORD</strong> : Votre mot de passe Docker Hub (ou un token d'accès).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1979" data-end="2061" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1981" data-end="2061" class=""><strong data-start="1981" data-end="2000">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</strong> : La clé privée SSH pour vous connecter à votre serveur VPS.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2063" data-end="2094" class="">4. Explication des étapes :</h3>
<ol data-start="2095" data-end="2797">
<li data-start="2095" data-end="2173" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2098" data-end="2173" class=""><strong data-start="2098" data-end="2118">Checkout du repo</strong> : <code data-start="2121" data-end="2142">actions/checkout@v2</code> pour récupérer le code source.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2174" data-end="2261" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2177" data-end="2261" class=""><strong data-start="2177" data-end="2194">Setup Node.js</strong> : <code data-start="2197" data-end="2220">actions/setup-node@v2</code> pour configurer l'environnement Node.js.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2262" data-end="2348" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2265" data-end="2348" class=""><strong data-start="2265" data-end="2297">Installation des dépendances</strong> : Installation des dépendances avec <code data-start="2334" data-end="2347">npm install</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2349" data-end="2413" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2352" data-end="2413" class=""><strong data-start="2352" data-end="2375">Lancement des tests</strong> : Exécution des tests via <code data-start="2402" data-end="2412">npm test</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2414" data-end="2491" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2417" data-end="2491" class=""><strong data-start="2417" data-end="2439">Build Docker image</strong> : Création d'une image Docker de votre application.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2492" data-end="2613" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2495" data-end="2613" class=""><strong data-start="2495" data-end="2530">Push de l'image vers Docker Hub</strong> : Utilisation des secrets pour se connecter à Docker Hub et pousser l'image créée.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2614" data-end="2797" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2617" data-end="2797" class=""><strong data-start="2617" data-end="2652">Déploiement sur serveur via SSH</strong> : Si vous avez un serveur à déployer, cette étape vous permet de vous connecter via SSH et déployer automatiquement l'application en production.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h3 data-start="2799" data-end="2839" class="">5. Ajouter les secrets dans GitHub :</h3>
<ol data-start="2840" data-end="3027">
<li data-start="2840" data-end="2896" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2843" data-end="2896" class="">Allez dans les paramètres de votre repository GitHub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2897" data-end="2944" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2900" data-end="2944" class="">Cliquez sur "Secrets" dans le menu à gauche.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2945" data-end="3027" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2948" data-end="3027" class="">Ajoutez les secrets <code data-start="2968" data-end="2985">DOCKER_USERNAME</code>, <code data-start="2987" data-end="3004">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code>, et <code data-start="3009" data-end="3026">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</code>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="3029" data-end="3220" class="">Cela devrait configurer votre pipeline CI/CD pour les étapes que vous souhaitez automatiser. Si vous avez des questions ou avez besoin d'aide pour la configuration, n'hésitez pas à demander !</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex absolute right-0 left-0 flex justify-start"><div <h3 data-start="98" data-end="151" class="">1. <strong data-start="105" data-end="151">Create the <code data-start="118" data-end="144">.github/workflows/ci.yml</code> file</strong></h3>
<p data-start="156" data-end="207" class="">If you haven't done so already, follow these steps:</p>
<ul data-start="215" data-end="416">
<li data-start="215" data-end="284" class="" style="">
<p data-start="217" data-end="284" class="">Create a <code data-start="226" data-end="245">.github/workflows</code> directory in the root of your project.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="292" data-end="416" class="" style="">
<p data-start="294" data-end="416" class="">Inside this directory, create a new file called <code data-start="342" data-end="350">ci.yml</code> (this is where the GitHub Actions configuration will be written).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="418" data-end="454" class="">2. <strong data-start="425" data-end="454">Add the steps to <code data-start="444" data-end="452">ci.yml</code></strong></h3>
<p data-start="456" data-end="542" class="">Now, in the <code data-start="468" data-end="476">ci.yml</code> file, you will define the workflow by adding the following steps:</p>

<p data-start="576" data-end="714" class="">This will pull your code from the GitHub repository. This step ensures that your workflow has access to the latest code in the repository.</p>

<p data-start="2430" data-end="2538" class="">Make sure to replace <code data-start="2451" data-end="2492">your-dockerhub-username/your-image-name</code> with your Docker Hub username and image name.</p>
<h4 data-start="2540" data-end="2590" class="">2.7 <strong data-start="2549" data-end="2590">(Optional) Deploy to a server via SSH</strong></h4>
<p data-start="2592" data-end="2767" class="">If you want to deploy your app to a server (like a VPS or Contabo server), you can add an SSH deployment step. To do this, you'll need to set up an SSH key as a GitHub secret.</p>

<h3 data-start="3091" data-end="3142" class="">3. <strong data-start="3098" data-end="3142">Configure GitHub Secrets for credentials</strong></h3>
<p data-start="3144" data-end="3292" class="">To securely store and use sensitive information like Docker Hub credentials and SSH keys, you need to configure GitHub secrets. Here’s how to do it:</p>
<ul data-start="3294" data-end="3794">
<li data-start="3294" data-end="3328" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3296" data-end="3328" class="">Go to your repository on GitHub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3329" data-end="3361" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3331" data-end="3361" class="">Click on the <strong data-start="3344" data-end="3356">Settings</strong> tab.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3362" data-end="3437" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3364" data-end="3437" class="">In the left sidebar, click on <strong data-start="3394" data-end="3405">Secrets</strong> under the <strong data-start="3416" data-end="3428">Security</strong> section.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3438" data-end="3483" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3440" data-end="3483" class="">Click the <strong data-start="3450" data-end="3475">New repository secret</strong> button.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3484" data-end="3794" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3486" data-end="3512" class="">Add the following secrets:</p>
<ul data-start="3515" data-end="3794">
<li data-start="3515" data-end="3562" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3517" data-end="3562" class=""><code data-start="3517" data-end="3534">DOCKER_USERNAME</code> — Your Docker Hub username.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3565" data-end="3628" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3567" data-end="3628" class=""><code data-start="3567" data-end="3584">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code> — Your Docker Hub password or access token.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3631" data-end="3794" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3633" data-end="3794" class=""><code data-start="3633" data-end="3650">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</code> — Your private SSH key for accessing your server (ensure that the corresponding public key is added to your server’s <code data-start="3768" data-end="3792">~/.ssh/authorized_keys</code>).</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

After pushing your <code data-start="26" data-end="52">.github/workflows/ci.yml</code> file and opening the <strong data-start="74" data-end="85">Actions</strong> tab, here's what to do <strong data-start="109" data-end="117">next</strong> to complete <strong data-start="130" data-end="167">Partie 4 : GitHub Actions – CI/CD</strong>:</p>
<hr data-start="170" data-end="173" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="175" data-end="235" class="">✅ <strong data-start="181" data-end="234">Step-by-step – What to do after creating <code data-start="224" data-end="232">ci.yml</code></strong>:</h3>
<hr data-start="237" data-end="240" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="242" data-end="296" class="">✅ 1. <strong data-start="252" data-end="296">Verify that the CI workflow is triggered</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="297" data-end="614">
<li data-start="297" data-end="614" class="" style="">
<p data-start="299" data-end="331" class="">After pushing the <code data-start="317" data-end="325">ci.yml</code> file:</p>
<ul data-start="334" data-end="614">
<li data-start="334" data-end="358" class="" style="">
<p data-start="336" data-end="358" class="">Go to <strong data-start="342" data-end="353">Actions</strong> tab.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="361" data-end="464" class="" style="">
<p data-start="363" data-end="464" class="">You should see a workflow run starting automatically (if it's triggered on <code data-start="438" data-end="444">push</code> or <code data-start="448" data-end="462">pull_request</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="467" data-end="512" class="" style="">
<p data-start="469" data-end="512" class="">Click on the workflow run to <strong data-start="498" data-end="511">view logs</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="515" data-end="614" class="" style="">
<p data-start="517" data-end="614" class="">Make sure all steps: checkout, setup Node.js, install dependencies, run tests, etc., <strong data-start="602" data-end="613">succeed</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="616" data-end="619" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="621" data-end="670" class="">✅ 2. <strong data-start="631" data-end="670">Set up Docker Hub Secrets on GitHub</strong></h4>
<p data-start="672" data-end="757" class="">Before the workflow can push to Docker Hub, you need to configure <strong data-start="738" data-end="756">GitHub Secrets</strong>:</p>
<ol data-start="759" data-end="1078">
<li data-start="759" data-end="785" class="" style="">
<p data-start="762" data-end="785" class="">Go to your GitHub repo.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="786" data-end="881" class="" style="">
<p data-start="789" data-end="881" class="">Click on <strong data-start="798" data-end="810">Settings</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="813" data-end="838">Secrets and variables</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="841" data-end="852">Actions</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="855" data-end="880">New repository secret</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="882" data-end="1078" class="" style="">
<p data-start="885" data-end="911" class="">Add the following secrets:</p>
<ul data-start="915" data-end="1078">
<li data-start="915" data-end="961" class="" style="">
<p data-start="917" data-end="961" class=""><code data-start="917" data-end="934">DOCKER_USERNAME</code> → your Docker Hub username</p>
</li>
<li data-start="965" data-end="1078" class="" style="">
<p data-start="967" data-end="1078" class=""><code data-start="967" data-end="984">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code> → your Docker Hub password or <a data-start="1015" data-end="1078" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="">Docker access token</a></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="1080" data-end="1127" class="">📌 You'll use these in your <code data-start="1108" data-end="1116">ci.yml</code> like this:</p>

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build-and-push-backend:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    # 1. Récupérer le code
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v3

    # 2. Setup Node.js pour tester ton backend
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v3
      with:
        node-version: 20

    # 3. Installation des dépendances
    - name: Install backend dependencies
      working-directory: ./backend
      run: npm install

    # 4. Lancer les tests (optionnel si tu as des tests)
    - name: Run backend tests
      working-directory: ./backend
      run: npm test || echo "no tests yet"

    # 5. Login Docker Hub
    - name: Docker Hub Login
      uses: docker/login-action@v3
      with:
        username: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
        password: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}

    # 6. Build &amp; Push Docker Image
    - name: Build &amp; Push backend Docker image
      run: |
        docker build -t ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}/user-management-backend:latest ./backend
        docker push ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}/user-management-backend:latest

class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="161" class="">Ton fichier <code data-start="12" data-end="20">ci.yml</code> est <strong data-start="25" data-end="44">presque parfait</strong> pour valider la <strong data-start="61" data-end="101">Partie 4 – CI/CD avec GitHub Actions</strong> ! Voici ce que tu peux faire <strong data-start="131" data-end="142">ensuite</strong>, étape par étape :</p>
<hr data-start="163" data-end="166" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="168" data-end="190" class="">✅ Étapes suivantes</h3>
<h4 data-start="192" data-end="235" class="">✅ 1. <strong data-start="202" data-end="235">Configurer les secrets GitHub</strong></h4>
<p data-start="236" data-end="342" class="">Dans ton repo GitHub, va dans :
<code data-start="268" data-end="278">Settings</code> → <code data-start="281" data-end="304">Secrets and variables</code> → <code data-start="307" data-end="316">Actions</code> → <code data-start="319" data-end="342">New repository secret</code></p>
<p data-start="344" data-end="369" class="">Ajoute ces deux secrets :</p>
<ul data-start="370" data-end="539">
<li data-start="370" data-end="424" class="" style="">
<p data-start="372" data-end="424" class=""><code data-start="372" data-end="389">DOCKER_USERNAME</code> → ton nom d'utilisateur Docker Hub</p>
</li>
<li data-start="425" data-end="539" class="" style="">
<p data-start="427" data-end="539" class=""><code data-start="427" data-end="444">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code> → ton mot de passe Docker Hub ou <a data-start="478" data-end="539" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="">un token sécurisé</a></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="541" data-end="544" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="546" data-end="589" class="">✅ 2. <strong data-start="556" data-end="589">Pusher vers la branche <code data-start="581" data-end="587">main</code></strong></h4>
<p data-start="590" data-end="636" class="">Ton workflow se déclenche sur les événements :</p>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="699" data-end="705" class="">Donc :</p>
<ul data-start="706" data-end="906">
<li data-start="706" data-end="830" class="" style="">
<p data-start="708" data-end="830" class="">Si ton fichier <code data-start="723" data-end="731">ci.yml</code> est dans une branche autre que <code data-start="763" data-end="769">main</code>, <strong data-start="771" data-end="780">merge</strong> ou <strong data-start="784" data-end="792">push</strong> vers <code data-start="798" data-end="804">main</code> pour que ça se déclenche.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="831" data-end="906" class="" style="">
<p data-start="833" data-end="906" class="">Ensuite, va dans l’onglet <strong data-start="859" data-end="870">Actions</strong> et observe l'exécution du workflow.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="908" data-end="911" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="913" data-end="950" class="">✅ 3. <strong data-start="923" data-end="950">Vérifier sur Docker Hub</strong></h4>
<p data-start="951" data-end="974" class="">Si tout se passe bien :</p>
<ul data-start="975" data-end="1138">
<li data-start="975" data-end="1138" class="" style="">
<p data-start="977" data-end="1138" class="">Tu verras l’image <code data-start="995" data-end="1027">user-management-backend:latest</code> dans ton Docker Hub, dans le dépôt nommé comme ton utilisateur Docker (ex: <code data-start="1103" data-end="1136">tonuser/user-management-backend</code>).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1140" data-end="1143" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="1145" data-end="1176" class="">🧠 Conseils supplémentaires</h3>
<h4 data-start="1178" data-end="1241" class="">💡 Optionnel : Ajouter un tag avec Git SHA pour versionner</h4>
